contentrichtext.text: {{Italic title prefixed|3}} Four ships of the [[United States Navy]] have borne the name '''''Davis'''''. The first three were named in honor of Admiral [[Charles Henry Davis|Charles H. Davis]]. The fourth, DD-937, was named for Commander [[George Fleming Davis|George F. Davis]]. * {{USS|Davis|TB-12}}, a [[torpedo boat]], launched 1898, sold for scrap 1920 * {{USS|Davis|DD-65}}, a {{sclass|Sampson|destroyer}}, launched 1916, sold 1934 * {{USS|Davis|DD-395}}, a {{sclass|Somers|destroyer|2}}, launched, 1938, sold 1947 * {{USS|Davis|DD-937}}, a {{sclass|Forrest Sherman|destroyer|2}}, launched 1956, decommissioned 1982 ==See also== *{{USS|Frederick C. Davis|DE-136}} *{{USS|George E. Davis|DE-357}} *{{USS|James L. Davis|1861}} *{{USS|M. M. Davis|SP-314}} *{{USS|Rodney M. Davis|FFG-60}} {{Shipindex}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Davis}} [[Category:United States Navy ship names]]
